net.powermatcher.core

Class BaseMatcherEndpoint.Connected

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.powermatcher.core.BaseMatcherEndpoint.Connected
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Agent.Status
    Enclosing class:
    BaseMatcherEndpoint

    public static class BaseMatcherEndpoint.Connected
extends java.lang.Object
implements Agent.Status
    The BaseMatcherEndpoint.Connected object describes the current status and configuration of an BaseMatcherEndpoint. This status can be queried through the BaseMatcherEndpoint.getStatus() method and will give a snapshot of the state at that time.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Creates a new BaseMatcherEndpoint.Connected object.

      boolean isConnected()
      For a agent to be connect, the Agent.setContext(FlexiblePowerContext) has been called and the agent has been configured with a clusterId (and usually a market basis).

        clusterId - the current cluster identifier of the cluster this matcher is connected to

      • getMarketBasis

        public MarketBasis getMarketBasis()

        getMarketBasis in interface Agent.Status
        Returns:
        the current MarketBasis on which this Agent is running and basing its Bids and Prices.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Description copied from interface: Agent.Status
        For a agent to be connect, the Agent.setContext(FlexiblePowerContext) has been called and the agent has been configured with a clusterId (and usually a market basis). Only if this is true should the agent be used normally. For an AgentEndpoint this means that it has been connected through a Session. For a MatcherEndpoint is can be connected simply by having a MarketBasis configured (e.g. for an Auctioneer).
        Specified by:
        isConnected in interface Agent.Status
        Returns:
        true when the agent is connected to the cluster.
